values:
Still alive. Still working my butt off.

It's been so long since I posted anything. Nice to see people around though.

This feels like the worst day of my life, but I know it actually isn't. Since my practicum, I have lost all confidence in my skills and even the knowledge that I acquired. I feel dumb, and it's the most dishearting feeling in the world. I need to sit down and study my life away just to be successful because my marks are going down hill quickly. I feel like I should just stay in school for another two years because I'm obviously missing quite a bit of knowledge they are trying to teach us. I hate feeling like this, like I'm some kind of unpopular failure at this program. Even worse is the fact that I know I'm acting way too emotional about the whole thing, and that the feeling will pass. I just wish I was a better person and better at the things that I try at.

My radiology class is going to be the death of me. I thought that I knew the material fairly well, but the marks that I've been getting back are less than satisfactory. I've never struggled in a class for this program more than radiology. It doesn't help that we have the Marking Nazi as our teacher. She's a great teacher and knows her stuff, but she marks like we should all be going to hell and rotting there. She even marks wrong for different ways of explaining things, so wording things in your own way is out.

I have to start getting prepared for my two practicums too. I really don't know how it will go, since we're thrown into the job with the training that we have, and I can't say that I feel ready. Working in a vet clinic is going to be fun, but I worry that I'm going to feel dumb or something. Plus, the one place that I want to go is relatively inaccessible at this time; I don't really want to pay for a hotel for three weeks.

It sucks staying at school for 11-12 hours a day. I don't have a life, and my moods are crap. :/

I don't even have the motivation for role-playing right now. I can't bring myself to hiatus just yet either. There should be more time in the day.

Has anyone had a job where co-workers make you feel stupid? Like, I know I'm a fairly educated person, but there are a lot of times in my summer job where I am made to feel like not knowing something deserves shunning. I think what's worse is that if you attempt to do something anyway (to stumble your way through and teach it to yourself by reading to box instructions), you get people telling you off. Asking doesn't help, since then they actually tell you to read the box instructions anyway. There's just something about some of my co-workers that just rub me the wrong way. Some have such a nasty double-standard, especially when it comes to work ethic. It's apparently okay for them to stand around shooting the shit, but damn, if you happen to stop to listen to a story someone is telling, you are going to get told off. I don't think I've actually worked in a place like this before. It doesn't help that I'm quite tired. School was a whirl-wind tour for eight months and now I'm working as hard as I can to make enough money to pay for the next semester of school. Then I get another whirl-wind tour for another ten months until I graduate with my diploma. I just need a holiday, but I suppose that's something to look forward to... you know, once I graduate, find a job, move house, and settle into a new life completely. Change is scary sometimes. I just try not to think about it much. Getting through the summer and then second year of school is what stresses me most... and the money issue. :/

OMG! A post! Apparently, they still exist. >.> They just don't happen often anymore. This is yet another pointless and over-dramatized rant about something that bugs me to the bottom most point of my left ventricle (because it is larger and has more power to pump my disdain). It think that it's bothered me for years, since I first became aware of them years and years ago. I find them pointless, cowardly, and a horrible waste of everyone's precious time. They usually end up becoming vile pits for dislike, over-opinionated riff-raff, blatant pointing of fingers and unfounded accusations. Yes, I'm talking about you "Anonymous Comms", where everyone in your f-list supports a horrible way to speak out against injustice (or just rant like a banshee about pointless tripe no one cares about but needs to get a dig about anyway). There are several out there to my knowledge, and I hate every single one of them. They are the most degrading and offensive communities that are on Livejournal. Now, they are infecting the internet with their srs business crap that involves anonymous memes, anonymous critiques, and anonymous food orders (okay, I made one up). I do know that the internet is clearly srs business, but have we really reduced ourselves to needing to hide behind an anonymous sign just to get a real honest-to-god opinion? And the opinions that are generally had are littered with over-dramatization, break down a person's self-esteem, involve wank like crazy, and breed all manner of hate and dislike. All of them (communities especially) are like pits of hungry sharks and when blood is introduced, they go CRAZY and take huge bites out of anything in their pond. The slander good communities, good people, and good concepts all for the purpose of 'making something better' or 'just cause'. It's a horrible policy to do business. Cowards do anonymous stuff. Get a backbone and show your face and name if you want to have a real opinion heard. Livejournal banned communities for sexual content and got flamed for it. Livejournal lets blatant harassment go on under their nose because it doesn't fall in their 'harassment' policy so long as names aren't mentioned or other personal information. It's a piss off. I hope people who go out of their way to run someone or something down in an anonymous community fall on a pointed stick and have it jab into their liver. They deserve it, the asstards.

School is trying to eat into my skull and devour my poor brain. I think the most difficult class in substance and class experience is Veterinary Clinical Pathology (study of blood and other lovely bodily fluids). It's like a massive info dump every class, and I end up wandering out with a headache every single time. We have a few new teachers that are kind of so-so with their teaching, but it is their first time. I know some people are frustrated that we are paying money and not actually getting the full teaching experience, but... that's what a textbook is for. Fecal Fridays... last class of the day and we get to look under a microscope at poop. It is a smelly, kind of nasty feeling lab... but oh so fun. My only frustration is that I haven't seen any little buggly eggs in any of my samples (which is good for the animal but bad for me). I want my learning experience! Where are the bugglies?! So sad... maybe we can view some tapeworm eggs next week. Though, next week is going to be a like a kick to the teeth. I have a quiz/test every day of the week, sometimes two on one day. Oh my brain... where will you go while I cram information packages inside of you. All this school work makes it really difficult to RP. I'm having a lot of trouble keeping up with the two that I'm in right now, and I keep telling myself it will be alright. I am coming to realize that I will probably have to drop one of them, but that decision seems so... final. At least I get to train my dog patient. That's always fun.

Spending two years away from school hasn't affected me as much as I thought it might have, but it is hard to keep excellent study habits when I'm used to having evenings and weekends as my own time. It was kind of easy in the beginning and the faculty made it seem like we would be eased in and helped along every step.

Day 3 was like getting smashed with the scientific dictionary. It was fast-paced and difficult to keep up with, and the teachers used words without definition that they expected us to know. It was really the first time that I came home after classes and immediately began to study my course notes to pick up on what I missed... and oh boy, it was a lot that I missed. I figure it gets worse from here on in, so I better get used to feeling frazzled and dumb until the terms become more clear.

Of course, the plus side is that the animals coming in came from my old workplace. Two animals I actually worked with, so I was happy to see them. I was paired up with a dog, but that dog has yet to arrive at the facility. I'm hoping taking the brute for a walk will clear my head and keep my on track!

It's actually kind of bad when I am left wondering who of my class will drop first. I'm hoping that everyone keeps going, but it's more material than even I expected (and I have a degree already). I can only imagine what someone from high school would think about course material like this, but you know what, it has been a long time since I was in high school. Times change, so maybe they will know more than I do.

The hardest part is running from the main building over to the science building. We really have to book it to get there in ten minutes and even then... some of us don't yet make it on time. We may not learn anything but mid-semester but damn it, we'll be in good shape! It will get worse with tons of snow too... I hope it's light this year.

I think my internet time is going to be cut into severely too. It kind of makes me nervous since I like the internet like whoa! We'll see in the coming weeks how things turn out, but I'm hoping that I get a better grasp so I can have my time on the 'net still.

This might just be me saying. Have you ever tried to be friends with someone and feel like your efforts are completely wasted? I bet it's just a matter of being 'too sensitive' over the idea. Wasn't it supposed to be 'give a little, get a little'?

On a brighter note, there seems to be a lot to do in the upcoming dayshift for <lj user="damned">. I hope that I can keep up, since this will be rather important meetings for one of my characters. It will hopefully build up some relationships outside of his fandom... well, fighter-types at least. Things had better go well anyway!

Hopefully the post-poned convention will be announced soon. I would be mad if it was called off completely, since it will be my first anime convention. Maybe I jinxed it. XD It sounds fairly positive that something has been worked out, but this waiting game is painful (I also happen to be waiting for my course list from the university, but that is bound to scare my pants off).

PS - Gackt... get out of my fandom.

*sigh* I think I really screwed up in <lj user="damned">. Sometimes I really wonder why the heck I do that? I need to stop assuming things, since this is the second times it's gotten me in trouble. -_-

I feel like a complete loser.

It's been a week today since I resigned from my job. It still feels like a vacation, though I admit to already being forgetful when it comes to the days of the week. I have to keep checking my computer calender in order to remember. And thankfully, work hasn't called me to ask questions and the like, though I keep dreaming about work. -_-

It's only a few more days before <lj user="ozzypoos"> arrives in Canada to stay with me for the next six months. It feels really weird to think about that, but I think it will be alright as well. I have plenty planned on what we are going to do and see, and I hope she doesn't think trees and mountains are boring or I could be in trouble. XD I'm still laughing about her having to experience a true Canadian winter, though mom says I should take her skiing. That would probably be completely disasterous.

Funny how I am almost finished the next chapter to Killer Instinct, but now that Sephiroth has arrived on the scene with his panties in a bunch I am having writer's block. I really would like to finish the chapter before Ozzy arrives. I figure that punishing Cloud is one thing that I'm really good at, so I'm not sure why my brain is farting over this.

*sigh* I wasted away the entire dinner shift in <lj user="damned">. I almost wish that Cloud was medicated in the morning instead of the evening, since it's so hard to get it done. He's all pissy about getting drugs shoved down his throat. I didn't even do anything with poor Hohenheim for dinner. He's probably too busy writing himself notes to really eat too much.

<lj user="damned"> is driving me crazy! CRAZY!

Okay, not the RP community, but my silly Hohenheim muse. He's been attacking my brain in that silent scheming way of his. He wants me to post more for him, and I really want to as well... hell, I would spam the community with his mad alchemic blabbering if I could. Unfortunately, that would be so out of character for him, it would probably warrant me getting a slap upside the head.

He's all eager and new and SHINY, and he says the weirdest things. He's so bad about throwing random pieces of unrelated information out in a conversation. I wanted to post for him on the bulletin board, but he's still in the mode of hiding himself from everyone who might be looking for him that I can't.

Not even Edward's shaking or rough way of telling him to get off his duff and do something useful hasn't spurred him enough. So sad he's the kind of guy who lurks around in the shadows because he has so much knowledge to share... and random tangents too. It's fun to have everyone angry at him and he's completely accepting of that fact. I suppose people get really strange when they have lived for 400+ years.

Though, I'm so happy! Only one character has tried to kill him! He's passed under the radar more than I expected... or maybe I had high-hopes for his arrival. o.O;;; I can never tell sometimes.

It's days like these that make me appreciate the fact that I've handed in my resignation at work. Despite having the largest amount of staff on possible, it seemed like nothing could actually go right. That's actually not true... we cleaned fast and did what had to be done as per general maintance.

<lj-cut text="Cut for Ranting that probably makes no sense">
Then I get a call from our health person saying we have 13 cats in our isolation (it can hold 8). So, I take the list of animals there to the assistant Branch Manager to make euthanasia decisions, since we are so over-crowded and that means none of the animals will actually get better. 8 is the maximum we can have (and I'm sure there's some statistics involved somewhere).

I, being certified in able to perform humane euthanasia, had to go and euthanize eight cats in order to make room (since we found out after that we needed to move some into isolation). As those decisions are made, another staff members comes from our intake room and says she was attacked by a cat, so we then had to make decisions for the cat intake room as well.

Sparing the gory details, 15 cats lost their lives today. I hate those days. They are so physically and emotionally draining.

So, then we get this call about a horse stuck in the mud by the overflowing river and unable to escape. It's time for everyone to go home, but myself and that assistant Branch Manager go to attend the call because we are nice like that and I didn't want her to have to do it by herself. It was on native reserve land, so animal control couldn't help us.

We find the property in question and locate the homeowner. Turns out that her husband hates the SPCA, but that aside, we go off to look for this horse. We find it trapped where the land has eroded away and it can't get up, and the husband is all pissy and tells us to go away. We stay anyway in order to help dig a path for the horse to get up, and we managed to calm the husband to accept our help calmly.

Then the two SPCs who we called for some help show up and basically tell us to go away because they can handle it. We leave and are walking through a field before the husband is heard cursing, swearing and shouting at the two SPCs for blundering up the operation and the horse spooked and ran into bushes which made it impossible to continue on with the plan. The nice calm husband who hates the SPCA is now extremely ugly and vulgar, but we leave anyway to let the SPCs handle it, since they messed it up in the first place.

I feel like I should be paid overtime for the hours I put in afterwards. It was a day from hell, and I'm so looking forward to having some time off.
</lj-cut>

I'm just looking forward to being able to sit for my two days off and catching up with my RPs which I am lagging on. I almost feel like losing myself in writing an application for another character in <lj user="damned">, but I don't know who I should apply for. Actually, I have two character I could, but... uh, the application is so long. -_- What should I do?

I can't remember the last time that I posted. Seriously, I can't. That must mean that it was over a month ago. Since I'm paying for this journal, I mine as well use it. XD I put in my resignation for work. That leaves me a tragic amount of free time to RP and write fanfiction. But that's okay and come Sept 2nd, I'll probably lose any life that I thought I had as I head back to school. Hopefully, I'll have lots of RPing and fanfiction out of the way... so I can concentrate on gaining awesome skillz in university. I'm going down to Anime Evolution in Vancouver and PAX in Seattle. Hopefully, it will be fun. They will be the first conventions that I will have ever attended. I'm looking forward to it. :D

Is it bad that my brain has been violently taken over by CloudxElena? It's never happened before, and I admit being WTF about it. I think it is safe to blame the original starters for this, which would be thoughts of CloudxTifa smut. I will point my finger over at for those starter ones. Anyway, I got my personal appraisal from by employer. The vote? I'm a damn awesome employee, but my ability to communicate sucks at times. Yeah, tell me something that I didn't know, would you? Oh, and I'm finally working on Killer Instinct again. It's been slow because I'm having a fiddily confrontation of sorts that has made me have to do some research on lines and such that would and wouldn't be said. That asides, I think it's going well. Hopefully, that Final Fantasy VII fic will wait its turn.

D:

There is so much bad fanfiction out there. It makes me want to cry. I think what I find far worse than bad fiction itself is that some of them start with an absolutely wonderful idea, but either their writing skills or ability to pace out the fic appropriately (sometimes both) is like a kick to the groin.

I find it sad to see such good flickers of ideas get butchered like a baby seal. Of course, it makes me want to write some of those ideas, but I can't. I consider that stealing, even though... it was a terrible fic.

Speaking with a friend about it, it really is sad to have that feeling of being so let down after thinking that the concept would shine through the miles of crap laid on top of it. The painful reading isn't worth for that small gem of an idea. We are both of the thinking that we should write them just so there is something good out there (assuming it can be salvaged).

I was tossing around the idea of doing a few challenges. I was thinking that over and realized that I know so few series that it would be difficult. Damn my sheltered life!

If anyone has an idea for a fic they want written, pass it along. I might see if I can poke at it... which may be doubtful. D:

Don't you just hate it when you are cleaning the bathroom (no, not mine) and you find yellow streaks down the wall next to/behind the toilet? I mean, seriously gentlemen... piss in the hole, not around it.

And if you miss, clean it up, you f-ing pigs.

Well, that was my day. :D

I was given the link to this website that was downright hilarious. ANyone that needs a laugh who hasn't already seen "Steve, Don't Eat It", I encourage you to read his blog. Some of the stuff he writes had me in stitches. I hope he updates :D Don't Eat It! A friend of mine keeps telling me to get into small paragraph prompts. I think that I should, but there are so many series out there that I don't know. I admit my cowardice when it comes to just putting things on the communities I'm in. I don't want to fail... at the internet! Woe! Someone might be making a .Hack//G.U. mood theme. :D I luvs them!

I saw Stardust last night. I thought it would be a lot more serious than it was, so I was pleasantly surprised. There were a lot of good jokes, and the Sky Pirate made everything about the movie worth it (I won't give spoilers). I really thought it would be titled 'Final Fantasy' under the 'Stardust' title. There is a new application period in coming up, and I know I want to apply for a character. I just don't know who I want to apply for, actually. My Cloud interpretation seems to have been well-received so far in the game, but now I feel I can have another character. My current list of possibilities is: Haseo (.Hack//G.U. - kind of want to wait on him since the 3rd volume is coming out in September) J.E.N.O.V.A (Final Fantasy VII 'cause mother knows best :D) Hugo (Suikoden III) Pesmerga (Suikoden I & II) Nagini (Harry Potter... don't you judge me. It's a freakin' snake!) Any suggestions? I'm planning on making trip to Vancouver in the next two weeks. I need to discuss with my manager when so I don't have the afterhours phone. So, and prepare yourselves. :D I need to good roadtrip!

I saved up all my money, and I finally went out and slapped down some money for a proper car audio system. It's going to cost me quite the bunch of cash, but it is going to look sweet in my ride. :D

I'm so happy! It took me months to save up my money for it, and I've been toying with the idea for awhile now. Of course, the place I went to seems really awesome, even though I have to wait until the end of the month for installation. It's still going to be worth it, and I get a lifetime warrenty on the labour done on my car.

I can't wait to shake my little red car up with some good base!

I'm considering quitting my job. It might just be a fleeting feeling, but there are elements in my job which makes things very difficult. There is actually a job opening up in the same position in a different shelter soon, and I've considered applying for it.

I have, unfortunately, stepped up my persistance about forcing euthanasia decisions. We have over 230 cats in our care with a shelter capacity for 75. There is still a road block with some of the employees when it comes to the difference between 'herd health' and 'individual health'. I find myself frustrated by the fact that there is very little support on this difficult decision and to actually make it is like pulling teeth from a baby.

And don't get me started on my euthanasia training... that's a disaster in motion.

Of course, I still am annoyed that I have been appointed Foster Coordinator, but I leave for staff training for a week... and I come back to no fosters left because of an upper-resp outbreak and all the staff wanted to save themselves from having to make euth decisions. That, of course, means I have no fosters for anything that might walk in the door... so we are, in a sense, boned up the ass for weeks. I have 6 week old kittens I have no foster for. -_-

The afterhours phone also really pisses me off. I see it having no point at all. The only people that call wouldn't know what a real emergency was even if it was dying at there feet. No, losing their dog, finding a cat, asking a question completely unrelated to anything that could be an emergency, wondering what their legal rights are... I'm sorry, piss off and stop calling the line reserved for critical distress animals. Call 1-800-I-Don't-Give-A-Shit or 1-800-Shut-Up-You-Whiny-Bitch.

I get yelled at enough during my normal work hours that I really don't need to get yelled at on my own time. It's bad enough how stupid people are. Some of the stories that I could tell right about now.

I have a few days to think about where I want to go with my life. Hopefully, I won't shoot someone first ;_;

It really amazes me how stressful some people are. I'm quickly figuring out that I work with some people that are like emotional car explosions driving backwards on a one-way street. I mean, I do normally love my job and co-workers but... geez, please take a pill?

I find that it doesn't help that I'm so nervous for next week as well. I'm really starting to doubt myself on whether or not I can handle what I'm about to do. It is a very large step that I could be completely excluded from my work for, but aside from one other person, there is no one with the emotional stability to complete this kind of training.

So, how do I feel about the thought of being certified in conducting the technique known as 'euthanasia'? I'm pretty uncertain. I've read and read all the manuels provided on it, but it is the emotional stress that I am concerned about. I have not yet seen a euthanasia, let alone thinking that it will be me easing the suffering of an animal.

I know it will separate me from my co-workers as well. I already feel like they are excluding me after the training was announced.

Mom says all the university level dissections that I have done will help me. I admit that I have seen and done things that a lot of people would revolt at. I just... don't want to grow more emotionally distant at work than I already am. I don't want to be enemy #1 at work.

Interestingly enough... veternarians experience death 5x more than their human-practisioner brethern. However, shelter staff experience death 7x more than either.

It's not about petting animals all day.

I saw Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End last night. It was such an awesome movie, and it seriously left me stunned in more than a few points of it. There was so much dark humour in it that it had to be appreciated on how well done that was. I want to see it again, if only for how it ends. :D

On a side note, there was a mass backstabbing going on between all of the characters. It was darker than the second movie, for certain. Everyone seemed like they were out to get everyone else, though I still hold true that Will had the most true intentions, even if they became very twisted by his methods.

And seeing Barbossa again made everything so sweet. He is such an awesome character, and, of course, we must not forget the appearance of Jack's dad. That had me laughing my ass off of just who it was. :P

*sigh* Yessssss, it was almost good enough for me to start writing terrible slash about it, much like I'm sure so many fangirls are already doing. Will was still so damn spanky. XD

Mom is like an emotional train-wreck. It's kind of stressful to deal with, and now dad is trying to talk her out of her dismal mood. -_-

In other news, work is such an interesting place to be in. If I wasn't so invested in the animals that I was taking care of, it would be such an interesting human behavioural study to see. There are so many self-absorbed welfare-greedy, low-lifes that walk into the shelter that it is honestly a little baffling.

Sandra and I are actually thinking of writing a book called "Shelter Rage", which is a spin-off of "Road Rage" which almost everyone is famous for at least once in their lives. We are thinking of bringing it up with the other staff and seeing what they think of it. We kind of are thinking of it as a humorous but informative guide to shelter life and the incidences that we experience.

One of the best incidences of "Shelter Rage" would be a woman calls to apply for our PAL program (an assistance program to help low-income spay/neuter their pets). She knows her income is too high, and she tells our staff member that if she is not approved for the PAL, she will be bringing us her 8 cats. Staff threatening is wonderful but tragic. People really do believe that the light of humanity shines out their assh*le. XD

In .Hack//G.U. news, I made Haseo cry. :D What a man! ...and all the characters want in his pants, seriously. It's crazy. @_@;;;

The adventures of kitten season begins.

I was given my first 10 day old kitten and asked to bottle feed it. It really makes one realize just how tiny and adorable babies are (hairy kitten babies, that is). They are just tiny little things that can't even retract their claws and seem to spill more mammalac all over them rather than eat it, but my goodness... they are so cute and squishable!

It is too bad that they don't have mom with them. We are hoping another female in the shelter will take them in, but it is not looking good so far. The mortality rate for babies is high too, but they are adorable.

Too bad I work so much or I would foster them. Little babies need feeding every two hours.

Still, they make me squee, and my overies threatened to hurt. I punched them, and it made everything better :D

Yay! I just got back from Australia yesterday. Thankfully, the jetlag wasn't all that bad, not like it was when I got back from Japan. I actually think I slept about an hour on the plane and that's it <s>Damn you Harry Potter book 6!</s>, and I kept myself up quite easily until 9:30pm on PST. I was very proud of myself.

Australia was pretty damn awesome too! I didn't get attacked by vicious deadly animals, nor did I manage to smuggle home an echidna or koala. I got to see them both, only the koalas in the wild though. I managed to pet and feed kangaroos, walabies and emus though, which as a lot of fun. There was a pelican that was trying to eat bark at one point too... and <lj user="ozzypoos"> ruined my innocence regarding rainbow macaws >.>

We went on a lot of road tours too, and we saw a lot of ocean and rocks. :D The big things we saw was the Razorback rock formation, The 12 Apostles, the Blowholes (which had fallen into the ocean >.>), a bronze Australian ass aimed at the highway. There were a lot of other things we saw, but their names elude me at this moment. Cleirland National Park was awesome and I highly recommend it to anyone going to Adelaide.

I'll probably go back again to see the Western portion of Australia, and maybe some of the North. I don't have a lot of interest in the Great Barrier Reef, mostly because the sharks there are huge <s>I saw Jaws too many times</s>.

Silly <lj user="ozzypoos"> managed to get my addicted to the yaoi series called Loveless. I've collected most of the manga and I've seen three episodes of the anime, though I'm sure I can expect more eventually. >.> Loveless was done by the same artist who created Earthian, who's manga I am also collecting because it is so damn awesome.

Finally started on the Fushigi Yuugi Genbu manga as well, and I picked up the Fushigi Yuugi series on DVD too. It will be nice to watch that again and get an idea on what is going on for the Genbu series. I need to write a post for my lovely Russian Suboshi too and German Nakago too. :D

Well... not really a hiatus, really. I'm just posting to say that I will be out of the country for a little over two weeks.

I'll be in Australia. :D See you later, my pretties!

PS - I promise to get back RPing when I get back.

Staff training was, at times, much like beating ones head against a table. I have forgotten how new people in the organization make me want to cry, and then I remember I was in that boat six months ago. Still, listening skills would have been beneficial for some of those people. -_-

Other times, it was great. Catsense was very exciting, and it gave me all sorts of new ideas on how to increase animal welfare at the shelter. I really hope we get the full course soon. I was told that the SPCA and my university are working together to do a animal behaviour degree... that was the best news of my life. I wanted a major in animal behaviour in my uni, but it wasn't available. It makes me excited to know I can go back and get it eventually. :D

Actually, I'm seriously considering going back to school again to pick up some courses that will help me better understand my career. I suppose I can't be skilled enough.

I can't believe it is only a week away now. It feels really unreal finally, and I'm getting excited. :D To think... meeting my first internet <s>stalker</s> friend for 15 days! So... April 6th - April 22nd, I'll be out of the country in Australia. :D

OMG, .HACK//REMINSCE IS COMING OUT MAY 8TH! *squee* ...unofficially, it seems. >.>
Going on staff training for the week. I doubt that I'll have internet access, so sorry for the inconvenience. Talk to everyone when I get back.

A 15 year old cat will sleep for 10 years of its life.

Interesting, no?

It is really amazing what some people will consider an emergency. I have been occasionally getting the SPCA emergency phone to answer in the afterhours. Now, this phone is for animals in critical distress. For those that don't know, critical distress is classified as "a stray animal who life will expire within a short period of time, normally less than an hour". These animals have usually been hit by vehicles, dropped off of three-story balconies (don't blink, we had to pick up a dog who had that happen), shot, massive body function shut down. That is the point of the emergency phone, that these animals will normally need to be euthanized humanely. Strays have no apparent owners, and thus, the SPCA has the legal right to euthanize or order veterinary assistance to save an animals life. That's what we are there for. The emergency phone is for such calls of animals in need of immediate veterinary care. So... when I get a call at 7:43am on my day off, I get a little aggitated when it is not critical distress like... *phone rings* ME: Uhhhhh... SPCA, Emergency Line... LADY: Uh hi! I don't really know if I should be calling here, but I think I saw a dead dog on the side of the highway. ME: ...you're not sure if it was a dog? LADY: No, I was just driving by and noticed it as I was going by it. ME: ...was it moving? LADY: I... don't really know. ME: *annoyed* Call animal control. They can pick up dead animals. LADY: Okay! ...please take in mind that if the dog *had* been moving, it would be critical distress, so it was sort of okay. It was the fact that she didn't really get a good look, I had no other calls, and that particular highway has quite a bit of truck traffic, meaning that "dog" could have been a piece of fallen bark or wood from trucks. -_- Actually, funny enough, that is probably the closest critical distress I have had on the phone. Most people call to ask me if I have heard about if their lost animal has turned up. I even had someone call and it went kind of like this: *phone rings* ME: Kamloops SPCA, please state your emergency. GUY: Well... it's not an emergency, more a question. I nearly shot myself at that single reply. Why do you call an "EMERGENCY PHONE NUMBER" to ask a question that has nothing to do with a critically ill animal? OMG, I wanted to ask him why he called in the first place because he's an idiot and I have to keep the line free for actual emergencies. Since... getting the emergency phone number, one has to call the SPCA and listen to our answering machine which states, "if this is an emergency that requires immediate assistance, please call [enter phone number]". So people have to take the time to write the number down and call it. Since December, I have never once received a "true" emergency call. >.> It just seems to reaffirm the fact that society in general... is very stupid. The best calls are, "My dog/cat died in the night. What do I do?" They get my goat every time, though I admit that if one didn't know, I would be calling around too. Normally, I would call a vet though. Or... I would bury the stupid body in the back yard!

So, watching the music video that  <lj user="ozzypoos"> made about Sephiroth and Cloud, it is infecting my brain a lot. I watch the silly thing every day, and love every bit of it. It is also making me want to write more Sephiroth and Cloud ficcies.

That epic floats around in my brain every time that I watch it. I think it has potential to be really good, but I wonder if I should make Sephiroth a bit of a demi-god in it. I don't want him a full god, since that would make him an impossible enemy, though according to AC, he had no trouble fighting against Cloud in there. I think I just want him to have a greater edge and make Cloud's situation a little more futile but not impossible.

I suppose it kind of helps that in my new epic, Cloud is 'special'. If I don't do something to Sephiroth, it might actually be Cloud with the edge. What kind of battle would that be? Psht, not much of one... since Cloud tends to win anyway. >.>

Kind of wish my reviewers from Killer Instinct were all around to peg them for questions on what they think would be awesome. Speaking of that, I need to get another chapter up for it. Until then, more SephxCloud movie!

My definition of constructive critism is that... "for every bad point made, a good one is made to balance it out". Maybe I'm the only one to feel that is the proper way to critique someone when writing a review that has those words of 'constructive critism' in them.

So when I get a review that says only bad things and pointing out errors in a way that isn't exactly the nicest, I take slight to it. I don't consider it to be constructive in anyway, unless the construction is to bring someone down and make them feel bad about how they write. It annoys me really, especially when the words "This isn't a flame and I'm sorry if you take it that way..." is thrown in at the end.

Sorry, but saying only negative things IS a flame in my eyes. I could just being sensitive, but don't call it something that isn't. A flame, even when put in fine words and grammar, is still a flame.

How is someone supposed to improve on their writing when they don't even know what they are doing right? Maybe it is just that there was nothing right with it in the first place, in which case... don't review. Didn't their mommy teach them, "If you have nothing nice to say, say nothing at all?" Put the good with the bad, not just the good and not just the bad.
 
A writer can hardly improve their writing if they just feel like crap. I don't think I'm being overly sensitive to it either, since I have received constructive critism on my fics, and I know what it looks like.

So take to heart that constructive means to build someone up and deconstructive is to take them down.

I was given .Hack//G.U. for Christmas, and it made me very happy. I have wanted that game since the beginning of summer and was eagerly awaiting its release in October. I had to hold off getting it since my parents wanted to get it for me for Christmas. My town sucks, so it went out of stock pretty quickly. However, my mom managed to get a copy for me. :)

I finally played it. OMG, that game is so damn awesome! It is much less confusing than the first four games of the original .Hack game... and there is a freaking data anominally that looks like a creepy Kite (main character from first four prequels). The story is pretty good so far, and the improvements to the battle system makes me squee for a long time. >.>

Haseo... Oh Haseo, you are such a bitter asshole. I love his character so much, and he's 10 times worse than Cloud was in the beginning of FFVII. He just tells people off and is quite rude, but somehow, he still manages to get along with some people when... er, they just don't talk. He's an awesome hero though, and I really enjoy him telling people to go away and that he refuses to take orders from anyone. He's quite loveable in that asshole~ish way. Though... with all the facial expressions he can make, I'm afraid that I find him very <s>downright hot and I will molest him</s> attractive. What a cutie.

Some of the female characters are very annoying. Surprisingly though, the dub isn't all that bad. I wish that they had kept the features that allowed for the original Japanese with English subtitles, but since the dub doesn't make me want to scream and bang my head on the floor, I guess that is acceptable. Let's hope the good plot keeps up for awhile yet!

Oh... I got Final Fantasy XII too, but that will have to wait until I finish .Hack//G.U. Haseo will have to suck my soul for like thirty hours yet! Ha!

I got my test marked from my course that I had to go to Vancouver for. It was bad when my instructor answered the phone with, "I've got good news and bad news. Which do you want first?" That got my feeling paranoid, so I obviously went with the bad first, so it would make the good seem all that much better... though, I thought he would say, "You failed".

He didn't thankfully. No, the bad news was that I expressed my answers on the test in an excessive amount of detail. He wanted a few lines for each answer and I gave him a page of writing for each one. He said it was unneeded and excessive... but that he couldn't find any wrong answers in my test either. Apparently, I A'ed it outright.

The good news was that he was certifying me. I am offically a DTA IV assessor and can gauge dog temperament in my shelter as and when required. I was so proud of myself. :D

The best part though was... I was the top in my class. I scored the highest on every aspect of the course, and I failed to acquire any faults for my manners of handling the dog... aka, I didn't put myself in danger. So, I'm head of my class at something! Yay!

I can't wait until I can do the CatSense course!

I volunteered myself for a Dog Temperment Assessment course, thinking that I wouldn't be choosen since Ange would probably get it. It seems that we are both going to the course to be trained in this skill of temperment assessment, which is all the way down in Vancouver.

I have to drive the highways to get myself and Ange down there, which ultimately freaks me out. The Coquihalla Highway is a death trap in the winter, one that I remember well as a child from the times we went down to the coast to visit family. Ange can't drive, and I kind of knew that I would have to if I got choosen.

So, I'll be down in Vancouver for a week studying my little brains out for dog behaviour. -_- Apparently there is a lot of scientific paper reading, which has been a long time for me. I might actually enjoy it since it has been 8 months since I've really gone through one. Of course, I have to do pre-reading before I head on down there.

The bad part is that I leave the day my parents get back, so I won't even be able to see them or pick them up from the airport. That is really upsetting since I was so looking forward to seeing them again, and they didn't take too well when I said I would get my brother to pick them up. My mom just said, "We'll take a cab".

The good part in all this is that all my holidays and stat days that have stacked up are given to me at the end of the year. With this course, I work a total of 8 days in the next four weeks of the schedule. >.> I have like... 5 days off, then work 1 then another 3 off. It's going to be so strange to have so much time off. I might be working Christmas though, as I offered my co-worker Sandra to switch me days (she works Christmas and I work Boxing day) so she could have the holiday off with her husband and not have to drive in from out of town for that.

I am completely not wanting anything to do with Christmas this year. It's the first year where I haven't wanted to go out and get things for people, but this year... it's just too much effort. The malls are already packed, and I'm really already sick of Christmas being a commercial money-job and nothing more. Christmas can just blow me.

It also doesn't help that for some people, I'm lost on gift ideas. Normally, I can think of a lot of things and it's just a matter of finding them, but this year... I'm having a real brain-fart about gifts. Of course, then I worry that people won't like the gifts that I'm getting them, and other people I keep thinking they probably already have the gift I'm thinking of. My brother is the worst person, actually <small>mostly because he's a thieving drug-addicted waste of life</small>.

In some ways, I prefer being at work than at home. At least at work, I can make work for myself whereas at home, I just feel really lonely. I just sell my soul as much as I can to Suikoden V and wait for mom and dad to come home.

I also want to stab my writing Sephiroth muse in the face. It's been too long since I updated my fic, but he refuses to budge, and it is driving me batty at this point. I'm starting to regret my decision to make each chapter a different perspective since Sephiroth is such a loser and his chapters are always shorter than Clouds are. I can't even tempt the guy with candy, and Hades makes him want to throttle something. -_-

Winter is also starting to get to me in a bad way. It has to be the winter months; I've already convinced myself of it.

It's so cold outside, my dog refuses to go outside even to pee. Welcome to Canada, ladies and gentlemen.

It's -29 oC (3 oF) outside at this very moment, with the windchill of course. We also got about a foot of snow in one dump. This makes me remember why I hate the great outdoors. I need to snuggle up to my computer for warmth. -_-

I really hate it when I'm in the middle of writing a multi-chapter fanfic, and another multi-chapter fanfic idea jumps up in wanting of attention. It is very frustrating since I refuse to start a new epic before the one I'm on is finished. -_-

On another note, I'm working on my parents' Christmas present. It's going to take so long, and I'm in trouble since I have an old version of Powerpoint Presentation, and I need a newer version. -_- How much does Microsoft Office versions cost nowadays anyway?

[EDIT:] I wanna go to Rainbow Land ._.

Happy Birthday, !

Thanks to everyone that sent me e-cards, e-mails and LJ posts about my B-day too! Much love to everyone! Good luck on your exams !

All women + work place = holy god, turn the bitch gene off!

Work has turned into a very interesting and stressful place. While it was originally rather stressful trying to keep up with learning, it seems to be stepping up a notch as personal views start to really get in the way. Conflicts that seemed to have been going on for awhile now are starting to really blow up.

It seems that most of the old co-workers are banding together in an attempt to get the Manager fired. They tried meeting with the CEO of the society last night, but the guy apparently never showed up when he said he would. I, of course, knew nothing of this meeting for whatever reason, but Sandra did -_-;;; I found out by Sandra asking about it this morning and Kim informing her the situation, so I was a little boggled.

Also, I get the feeling that Sandra is cracking under the pressure. The last week that I've worked with her, she has nearly or has broken down into tears every day. I feel really bad for her because she's just an awesome person, but I wonder how she will honestly handle neglect and abuse cases when she can't even crate a sick cat for euthanisia. No, it's not an easy job to do, but by now, it should be handled in my opinion... since she has been working longer than I have.

I would hate to see her go. We get along well and have similar work ethics, which makes things a lot easier there.

Still, I'm conflicted on this whole 'overthrow the manager' thing that is going on. I don't know if I should take a side or just stay out of it. I feel like I should do something, but getting involved could put myself at risk as well, since no one talks to me about issues anyway. Still, I have no knowledge of the manager doing anything 'bad', nothing that would warrent this kind of back-stabbing behaviour (but then... these are women we are talking about). It makes me kind of erked.

And, I am one to defend my own gender, but seriously, even I admit that women are horrible people to work with when there is no men to balance the numbers. We have tendencies to back-stab and be overly bitchy for the littlest things. Not all workplaces are like that, but there are more than a few that are. -_-

Job-related hazards? Yep, got those!

Everybody knows that when you deal with animals, there is a chance that you're going to get hit. I've been 'hit' several times on my hands and arms since starting work at the SPCA, but it was just some of those things that happened. Cats were grumpy; cats were playing; cats were scared.

Dealing the feral (ie wild or non-humanized) cats are a particular hazard in the workplace. People think that cats hanging around should be dealt with, so bring them in and leave us to deal with the mess. Feral cats are normally just hissy, frightened little suckers. Some can be brought around with affection and hard work, while others have been feral too long to be publically safe for adoption.

One of the feral cats and I met up in a battle of wits, strength and sharp claws/teeth. Sandra and I were going to clean the kennel, where it had escaped the day before. We decided it was safest to push the hidey-hole forward to block escape so we could get the litter box and dust. Well, the moment we pushed on the hidey-hole (plastic tub with a round hole at one end usually used as an entrance for litterbox or bed), the cat was up and out.

After cleaning the kennel up, it was my job to grab the sucker and put him back in the kennel. Well... I had the proper gloves on thankfully, but the poor beast managed to swing around in my hold and get ahold of my shirt, where it then processed to haul itself up and across my face. -_- It nailed me pretty good with two scratches down my cheek, one on my nose and several claw marks under my eye (I was fortunate to have glasses so the claws didn't get to my eyes themselves).

He might have nailed me with claws and then tried to rip my thumb off (got a bruise from that) when I caught him again, but I defeated him with a grabbing technique that would make professional wrestlers proud. He went back to his kennel thankfully, and I had to go to the doctor.

Now, I'm on antibiotics to try to keep any infection away. My co-workers were kind of horrified when I first appeared since I had blood running down my face, and then my face started to swell up. Thankfully, I was only hit with claws and not actually bitten, or it might have been much worse than it actually was; cats have very dirty mouths that can lead to horrible things like blood poisoning and severe infections that swell body parts up huge.

I suppose that no one can say my job is boring. I can now put 'cat wrangler' on my resume. I'd still rather deal with cats than some people, quite honestly.

ZOMG, I SAW .HACK//G.U. AT THE STORE!!! *SQUEE*

Ever had one of those days where being lazy is so much easier than being productive? Oh yeah, I had one of those day. I woke up, fed the animals with all intentions of doing all my chores. What did I do? I went I played Suikoden V until I got too cold, then got dressed to warm up and have since been on the computer being molested by bunnies.

...not those good bunnies either. The bad naughty kind of bunnies that wear leather and have whips and sometimes eye-patches. They are scary, and they have been humping my frontal lobe. Two major bunnies have managed to get me, but they are both to the Suikoden series (god, I love those games).

I will have to find a place to share them with other Suikoden fans... if I ever write them. I hope so, but I'm caught up in writing up an email so they might have to wait.

Of course, somehow I've ended up in a giggly hyper mood. It's awesome, and it's only here because I'm on a day off. >.> Seriously, I was so depressed the other night, but now I'm better than... er better (My cat just stuck her nose in my eyeball! Aaaah, that hurts!). My good mood is probably the reason that nothing is getting done today. :P

When starting a novel... I'm just finding out that the opening line is the hardest one to come up with. It's completely elusive to me right now. I'm itching to start, but I just can't get down the first line to propel myself forward. Grrrrreeeeh, this is so frustrating. -_-

I will comfort myself with Oreos and yaoi. That will solve all that is wrong with the world at this moment. *munches*

Novels are daunting as well. I question my writing skills when I think about it, but the idea is sound (my ideas normally are). Are my skills good enough for it? I suppose I can have someone proof-read it when I actually get something down for constructive critism about it.

Also, I'm not certain if my normal technique of switching between characters POVs from paragraph to paragraph would be successful. Most writings that I've encountered are purely in first person or third person with one main POV per chapter/novel. It's so... not my normal style.

Today was one of the worst days that I've had in a long time. ;_; One of my co-workers bitched me out at every opportunity and ordered me around like a freakin' slave with an IQ of 40. It was just not good all around... though, the 25th was my official 1 month day of employment... 1/3 way through my probationary period.

That aside, I want to write. I have mini bunnies that go no where all over the place, and I so want to write something. I wish that I had inspiration to get something out on a pad to make the day worthwhile. I was thinking something original, since the FFVII stuff dies before I type a word.

Now, back to squishing my brain for any sort of inspiration. Any ideas or bunnies from others might inspire me! Suggest! Suggest!

I'm never allowed to walk into a pet store on a day off again. Seriously, I go in to look at the new layout of the Petland and to get kitten food for my foster babies. That goes fine until I look over and see the nifty new fish department... and somehow, I'm walking out of the store with a new <s>squeetastic beautiful</s> Betta fish in a bag.

Never again! No pet stores for me unless on work hours!

*ahem* Anyway, Hix (yes, I named him already) is gorgeous. Actually, he's a bit of a throw-back in the gene pool I think. >.> His pectoral fins, which on almost all Bettas are clear and small rounded and look like paddles to steady movement, are long almost like the show fins that hang down near his gills... aka, long and with colouration on the tips. I saw him and knew that I had to have him. He's really pretty and as soon as I can actually get a camera, I'm going to take a picture of him. :D

Trying to call over to the Cook Islands has been disasterious this year. 9 times out of 10, I can't get through. The last two calls have been cut off and have been so full of white noise that I can barely make out anything that my parents say. It's so damned frustrating since we want to talk to each other and can't thanks to the stupid connection. Email is probably going to be the main mode of communication now, which so sucks. -_-

I really wish that my Killer Instinct Sephiroth would talk to me. He's being a big meany and not talking to me, which makes writing his chapter very difficult. I really wanted to get the chapter out this week, but I don't know if that will be possible with how stubborn he is being. At least I managed to introduce Tifa and Aerith... though meeting this Cloud will be interesting given his personality <s>so maybe Tifa will have to try to kick his butt</s>.

Oh yeah, score for the random entry! *flips and disappears*

Talking about work is depressing most of the time, so I will say nothing about it. I've figured out that talking about it to anyone beyond co-workers is something I should avoid... for many reasons. Anyway, so the parentals are off and gone to the Cook Islands where they will weather the hot sun, empty beaches, car with windows that won't roll up, and endless crystal clear South Pacific waters. Oh woe, how will they survive?! It's nice to have the house to myself, even if I am in charge of all their expenses and taking care of everything in the place. It's not like I haven't done it before. I hope that they have a good time, as this is probably the last holiday that they get out of country, given that travel insurance gets insanely expensive the older one becomes. I think I have to call them tonight. >.> I can't remember, but I will anyway since mom gets misty-eyed if I don't call. She's so funny and attached. In other news, .Hack//G.U. Vol 1 - Rebirth comes out on the 24th!!!! *fangirl squee* I have been waiting for that game since it was announced a year ago, and I must get my hands on it... unfortunately, it's on my x-mas list and I'm pretty sure my parents already have it on back order so I'll have to wait ;_; OMG, .Hack, you make me squee like a virgin seeing a yaoi doujinshi for the first time! I'll probably grab Final Fantasy XII as well, since it's looking mighty shiny and all the reviews for it make it sound extra good. Those are about the only two games I'm actually looking forward to, even if .Hack owns my soul and wallet is much more anticipated. ...did I mention that I currently have two little kittens that I'm fostering? They are so cute and love to purr all the time. >.> Too bad they are sick and I'm nursing them back to health. I wish I had Lulu's tiger icon to express how much love the kitties are!

After about 7 years of nothing on the sickness front, I've finally fallen ill. It's a cold, but it is miserable since I refuse to take a day off work and went anyway. Now, I'm going to curl up on the couch and ignore the world completely.

At least I started X-mas and B-day shopping before I fell ill. This better not last long, or there will be trouble. -_-
